concept.title: oxy_action_list() Function
concept.shortdesc: This function allows you to define a list of actions directly in the CSS, rather than referencing them from the associated framework.

conbody.p: The oxy_action_list() function is used from the oxy_buttonGroup() function.

The arguments received by the oxy_action_list() function are a list of actions that are defined with the oxy_action() function. The following properties are supported in the oxy_action_list() function:

p.codeblock: oxy_action_list( oxy_action( name, 'Insert', description, 'Insert an element after the current one', operation, InsertFragmentOperation, arg-fragment, '<element></element>', arg-insertLocation, '.', arg-insertPosition, 'After' ), oxy_action( name, 'Delete', description, 'Deletes the current element', operation, DeleteElementOperation ) )

conbody.note: A code template is available to make it easy to add the oxy_action_list function with the Content Completion Assistant by pressing and select the oxy_action_list code template.
